operations.summary: Fetch a list of events from your Okta organization system log.

operations.description: Creates a new session for a user with a valid session token. Use this API if, for example, you want to set the session cookie yourself instead of allowing Okta to set it, or want to hold the session ID in order to delete a session via the API instead of visiting the logout URL.
Get details about a session.

queryParams.description: Finds a user that matches firstName, lastName, and email properties
queryParams.name: q

queryParams.description: Filters users with a supported expression for a subset of properties
queryParams.name: filter

queryParams.description: Searches for users with a supported filtering  expression for most properties
queryParams.name: search

operations.description: Lists users in your organization with pagination in most cases.  A subset of users can be returned that match a supported filter expression or search criteria.

queryParams.description: Executes activation lifecycle operation when creating the user
queryParams.name: activate

queryParams.description: Indicates whether to create a user with a specified authentication provider
queryParams.name: provider

queryParams.description: With activate=true, set nextLogin to "changePassword" to have the password be EXPIRED, so user must change it the next time they log in.
queryParams.name: nextLogin

operations.description: Creates a new user in your Okta organization with or without credentials.
Deletes a user permanently.  This operation can only be performed on users that have a `DEPROVISIONED` status.  **This action cannot be recovered!**
Fetches a user from your Okta organization.
Update a user's profile and/or credentials using strict-update semantics.
Fetches appLinks for all direct or indirect (via group membership) assigned applications.

Changes a user's password by validating the user's current password.  This operation can only be performed on users in `STAGED`, `ACTIVE`, `PASSWORD_EXPIRED`, or `RECOVERY` status that have a valid [password credential](#password-object)

Changes a user's recovery question & answer credential by validating the user's current password.  This operation can only be performed on users in **STAGED**, **ACTIVE** or **RECOVERY** `status` that have a valid [password credential](#password-object)

Generates a one-time token (OTT) that can be used to reset a user's password.  The user will be required to validate their security question's answer when visiting the reset link.  This operation can only be performed on users with a valid [recovery question credential](#recovery-question-object) and have an `ACTIVE` status.
Enumerates all the enrolled factors for the specified user

queryParams.description: id of SMS template (only for SMS factor)
queryParams.name: templateId

operations.description: Enrolls a user with a supported [factor](#list-factors-to-enroll)
Enumerates all the [supported factors](#supported-factors-for-providers) that can be enrolled for the specified user
Enumerates all available security questions for a user's `question` factor
Unenrolls an existing factor for the specified user, allowing the user to enroll a new factor.
Fetches a factor for the specified user
The `sms` and `token:software:totp` [factor types](#factor-type) require activation to complete the enrollment process.
Verifies an OTP for a `token` or `token:hardware` factor
Fetches the groups of which the user is a member.

queryParams.description: Sends an activation email to the user if true
queryParams.name: sendEmail

operations.description: Activates a user.  This operation can only be performed on users with a `STAGED` status.  Activation of a user is an asynchronous operation.  The user will have the `transitioningToStatus` property with a value of `ACTIVE` during activation to indicate that the user hasn't completed the asynchronous operation.  The user will have a status of `ACTIVE` when the activation process is complete.

Deactivates a user.  This operation can only be performed on users that do not have a `DEPROVISIONED` status.  Deactivation of a user is an asynchronous operation.  The user will have the `transitioningToStatus` property with a value of `DEPROVISIONED` during deactivation to indicate that the user hasn't completed the asynchronous operation.  The user will have a status of `DEPROVISIONED` when the deactivation process is complete.

queryParams.description: Sets the user's password to a temporary password,  if true
queryParams.name: tempPassword

operations.description: This operation transitions the user to the status of `PASSWORD_EXPIRED` so that the user is required to change their password at their next login.

This operation resets all factors for the specified user. All MFA factor enrollments returned to the unenrolled state. The user's status remains ACTIVE. This link is present only if the user is currently enrolled in one or more MFA factors.
Generates a one-time token (OTT) that can be used to reset a user's password.  The OTT link can be automatically emailed to the user or returned to the API caller and distributed using a custom flow.
Suspends a user.  This operation can only be performed on users with an `ACTIVE` status.  The user will have a status of `SUSPENDED` when the process is complete.
Unlocks a user with a `LOCKED_OUT` status and returns them to `ACTIVE` status.  Users will be able to login with their current password.
Unsuspends a user and returns them to the `ACTIVE` state.  This operation can only be performed on users that have a `SUSPENDED` status.
Lists all roles assigned to a user.
Assigns a role to a user.
Unassigns a role from a user.
Success
Success
Success

queryParams.description: Revoke issued OpenID Connect and OAuth refresh and access tokens
queryParams.name: oauthTokens

queryParams.description: Sends an activation email to the user if true
queryParams.name: sendEmail

operation.description: Activates a user.  This operation can only be performed on users with a `STAGED` status.  Activation of a user is an asynchronous operation.  The user will have the `transitioningToStatus` property with a value of `ACTIVE` during activation to indicate that the user hasn't completed the asynchronous operation.  The user will have a status of `ACTIVE` when the activation process is complete.

Deactivates a user.  This operation can only be performed on users that do not have a `DEPROVISIONED` status.  Deactivation of a user is an asynchronous operation.  The user will have the `transitioningToStatus` property with a value of `DEPROVISIONED` during deactivation to indicate that the user hasn't completed the asynchronous operation.  The user will have a status of `DEPROVISIONED` when the deactivation process is complete.
Suspends a user.  This operation can only be performed on users with an `ACTIVE` status.  The user will have a status of `SUSPENDED` when the process is complete.
Unsuspends a user and returns them to the `ACTIVE` state.  This operation can only be performed on users that have a `SUSPENDED` status.
Generates a one-time token (OTT) that can be used to reset a user's password.  The OTT link can be automatically emailed to the user or returned to the API caller and distributed using a custom flow.

queryParams.description: Sets the user's password to a temporary password,  if true
queryParams.name: tempPassword

operation.description: This operation transitions the user to the status of `PASSWORD_EXPIRED` so that the user is required to change their password at their next login.
Unlocks a user with a `LOCKED_OUT` status and returns them to `ACTIVE` status.  Users will be able to login with their current password.

This operation resets all factors for the specified user. All MFA factor enrollments returned to the unenrolled state. The user's status remains ACTIVE. This link is present only if the user is currently enrolled in one or more MFA factors.
Adds a [user](users.html#user-model) to a group with `OKTA_GROUP` type.

queryParams.description: id of SMS template (only for SMS factor)
queryParams.name: templateId

operation.description: Creates a new user in your Okta organization with or without credentials.

Verifies an OTP for a `token` or `token:hardware` factor

listUsers.description: Lists users in your organization with pagination in most cases.  A subset of users can be returned that match a supported filter expression or search criteria.

listAppLinks.description: Fetches appLinks for all direct or indirect (via group membership) assigned applications.

changePassword.description: Changes a user's password by validating the user's current password.  This operation can only be performed on users in `STAGED`, `ACTIVE`, `PASSWORD_EXPIRED`, or `RECOVERY` status that have a valid [password credential](#password-object)

changeRecoveryQuestion.description: Changes a user's recovery question & answer credential by validating the user's current password.  This operation can only be performed on users in **STAGED**, **ACTIVE** or **RECOVERY** `status` that have a valid [password credential](#password-object)

forgotPassword.description: Generates a one-time token (OTT) that can be used to reset a user's password.  The user will be required to validate their security question's answer when visiting the reset link.  This operation can only be performed on users with a valid [recovery question credential](#recovery-question-object) and have an `ACTIVE` status.

listUserGroups.description: Fetches the groups of which the user is a member.

queryParams.description: Sends an activation email to the user if true
queryParams.name: sendEmail

activateUser.description: Activates a user.  This operation can only be performed on users with a `STAGED` status.  Activation of a user is an asynchronous operation.  The user will have the `transitioningToStatus` property with a value of `ACTIVE` during activation to indicate that the user hasn't completed the asynchronous operation.  The user will have a status of `ACTIVE` when the activation process is complete.

deactivateUser.description: Deactivates a user.  This operation can only be performed on users that do not have a `DEPROVISIONED` status.  Deactivation of a user is an asynchronous operation.  The user will have the `transitioningToStatus` property with a value of `DEPROVISIONED` during deactivation to indicate that the user hasn't completed the asynchronous operation.  The user will have a status of `DEPROVISIONED` when the deactivation process is complete.

queryParams.description: Sets the user's password to a temporary password,  if true
queryParams.name: tempPassword

expirePassword.description: This operation transitions the user to the status of `PASSWORD_EXPIRED` so that the user is required to change their password at their next login.

resetAllFactors.description: This operation resets all factors for the specified user. All MFA factor enrollments returned to the unenrolled state. The user's status remains ACTIVE. This link is present only if the user is currently enrolled in one or more MFA factors.

resetPassword.description: Generates a one-time token (OTT) that can be used to reset a user's password.  The OTT link can be automatically emailed to the user or returned to the API caller and distributed using a custom flow.

suspendUser.description: Suspends a user.  This operation can only be performed on users with an `ACTIVE` status.  The user will have a status of `SUSPENDED` when the process is complete.

unlockUser.description: Unlocks a user with a `LOCKED_OUT` status and returns them to `ACTIVE` status.  Users will be able to login with their current password.

unsuspendUser.description: Unsuspends a user and returns them to the `ACTIVE` state.  This operation can only be performed on users that have a `SUSPENDED` status.

listAssignedRoles.description: Lists all roles assigned to a user.

addRoleToUser.description: Assigns a role to a user.

removeRoleFromUser.description: Unassigns a role from a user.

queryParams.description: Revoke issued OpenID Connect and OAuth refresh and access tokens
queryParams.name: oauthTokens

endAllUserSessions.description: Removes all active identity provider sessions. This forces the user to authenticate on the next operation. Optionally revokes OpenID Connect and OAuth refresh and access tokens issued to the user.

queryParams.description: Revoke issued OpenID Connect and OAuth refresh and access tokens
queryParams.name: oauthTokens

operation.description: Removes all active identity provider sessions. This forces the user to authenticate on the next operation. Optionally revokes OpenID Connect and OAuth refresh and access tokens issued to the user.

Changes a user's recovery question & answer credential by validating the user's current password.  This operation can only be performed on users in **STAGED**, **ACTIVE** or **RECOVERY** `status` that have a valid [password credential](#password-object)

This operation can only be performed on users with a valid [recovery question credential](#recovery-question-object) and have an `ACTIVE` status.

queryParams.description: Sends an activation email to the user if true
queryParams.name: sendEmail

operation.description: Activates a user.  This operation can only be performed on users with a `STAGED` status.  Activation of a user is an asynchronous operation.  The user will have the `transitioningToStatus` property with a value of `ACTIVE` during activation to indicate that the user hasn't completed the asynchronous operation.  The user will have a status of `ACTIVE` when the activation process is complete.

Deactivates a user.  This operation can only be performed on users that do not have a `DEPROVISIONED` status.  Deactivation of a user is an asynchronous operation.  The user will have the `transitioningToStatus` property with a value of `DEPROVISIONED` during deactivation to indicate that the user hasn't completed the asynchronous operation.  The user will have a status of `DEPROVISIONED` when the deactivation process is complete.
Suspends a user.  This operation can only be performed on users with an `ACTIVE` status.  The user will have a status of `SUSPENDED` when the process is complete.
Unsuspends a user and returns them to the `ACTIVE` state.  This operation can only be performed on users that have a `SUSPENDED` status.
Generates a one-time token (OTT) that can be used to reset a user's password.  The OTT link can be automatically emailed to the user or returned to the API caller and distributed using a custom flow.

queryParams.description: Sets the user's password to a temporary password,  if true
queryParams.name: tempPassword

operation.description: This operation transitions the user to the status of `PASSWORD_EXPIRED` so that the user is required to change their password at their next login.
Unlocks a user with a `LOCKED_OUT` status and returns them to `ACTIVE` status.  Users will be able to login with their current password.

This operation resets all factors for the specified user. All MFA factor enrollments returned to the unenrolled state. The user's status remains ACTIVE. This link is present only if the user is currently enrolled in one or more MFA factors.
Adds a [user](users.html#user-model) to a group with `OKTA_GROUP` type.

queryParams.description: id of SMS template (only for SMS factor)
queryParams.name: templateId

operation.description: Enrolls a user with a supported [factor](#list-factors-to-enroll)
Enumerates all the [supported factors](#supported-factors-for-providers) that can be enrolled for the specified user
Enumerates all the enrolled factors for the specified user
Enumerates all available security questions for a user's `question` factor
Fetches a factor for the specified user

queryParams.description: Executes activation lifecycle operation when creating the user
queryParams.name: activate

queryParams.description: Indicates whether to create a user with a specified authentication provider
queryParams.name: provider

queryParams.description: With activate=true, set nextLogin to "changePassword" to have the password be EXPIRED, so user must change it the next time they log in.
queryParams.name: nextLogin

operation.description: Creates a new user in your Okta organization with or without credentials.
Fetches a user from your Okta organization.
Update a user's profile and/or credentials using strict-update semantics.
Deletes a user permanently.  This operation can only be performed on users that have a `DEPROVISIONED` status.  **This action cannot be recovered!**
The `sms` and `token:software:totp` [factor types](#factor-type) require activation to complete the enrollment process.
Verifies an OTP for a `token` or `token:hardware` factor
Unenrolls an existing factor for the specified user, allowing the user to enroll a new factor.
Activates an inactive application.
Deactivates an active application.

queryParams.description: specifies the pagination cursor for the next page of assignments
queryParams.name: after

queryParams.description: specifies the number of results for a page
queryParams.name: limit

operation.description: Enumerates all assigned [application users](#application-user-model) for an application.

Assigns an user to an application with [credentials](#application-user-credentials-object) and an app-specific [profile](#application-user-profile-object). Profile mappings defined for the application are first applied before applying any profile properties specified in the request.
operation.summary: Assign User to Application for SSO & Provisioning

operation.description: Fetches a specific user assignment for application by `id`.
Assigns a group to an application
Fetches an application group assignment

queryParams.description: Unique key of the target Application
queryParams.name: targetAid

operation.description: Clones a X.509 certificate for an application key credential from a source application to target application.
Gets a specific [application key credential](#application-key-credential-model) by `kid`

queryParams.description: Specifies the pagination cursor for the next page of assignments
queryParams.name: after

queryParams.description: Specifies the number of results for a page
queryParams.name: limit

operation.description: Enumerates group assignments for an application.
Enumerates key credentials for an application
Fetches an application from your Okta organization by `id`.
Updates an application in your organization.
Removes an inactive application.
